data.title: Saint Stanislaus College (1890)
data.meta_description: In 1890, St. Stanislaus Kosta (the first Polish parish established in Chicago, located at the southeast corner of Noble St. and Evergreen Ave.) opened a college (later renamed Weber high school) in their old church. Nine years later they relocated to this four story yellow brick building, located at 1521 W. Haddon Ave., which contained a gymnasium, cafeteria, and classrooms. Two years later, St. Stanislaus College was renamed Weber high school after Archbishop Joseph Weber. It remained at this location for the next 50 years.
data.text: In 1890, St. Stanislaus Kosta (the first Polish parish established in Chicago, located at the southeast corner of Noble St. and Evergreen Ave.) opened a college (later renamed Weber high school) in their old church. Nine years later they relocated to this four story yellow brick building, located at 1521 W. Haddon Ave., which contained a gymnasium, cafeteria, and classrooms. Two years later, St. Stanislaus College was renamed Weber high school after Archbishop Joseph Weber. It remained at this location for the next 50 years.
